modelInput.system: You are acting as a researcher evaluating if a patient profile is suitable for a clinical trial.

messages.content:
We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

<study>{
    "Inclusion Criteria": [
        "18-65 years of age",
        "Chief complaint of headache",
        "International Classification of Headache Disorder classification of migraine or probable migraine with or without aura",
        "Has decision making capacity",
        "Consent",
        "Provider determination of non-emergent cause"
    ],
    "Exclusion Criteria": [
        "Over the age of 50 with first time headache",
        "Known adverse reaction or tolerance to study medication",
        "Headache due to trauma",
        "New onset, focal, abnormal, neurologic findings",
        "New onset seizures",
        "History of metastatic cancer or neoplasm",
        "Active psychotic symptoms",
        "Altered mental status",
        "Provider intends to preform lumbar puncture",
        "Pregnancy",
        "Breast feeding",
        "Previous enrollment in study",
        "Fever > 100.3 F",
        "Physiologic instability (blood pressure < 90/50 or >170/100, heart rate <50 or >120, chronic respiratory, renal or hepatic failure)",
        "Suspected cardiac pain"
    ]
}</study>

Please provide your response for each of the study criteria as

(good candidate) Yes this patient is a good candidate for the scientific study.
(likely good candidate) It is likely that this patient is a good candidate for the scientific study but more information might be needed.
(likely bad candidate) It is unlikely that this patient is a good candidate for the scientific study but more information might be needed.
(bad candidate) No this patient is not a good candidate for the scientific study.

and an explanation with references to the patient information for why you chose each response

in a JSON reponse.

If there is no evidence in the patient record for a exclusion condition, choose good candidate.

If the Inclusion criteria you are evaluating is an age range, choose good candidate if the patient falls within the age range, choose bad candidate if the patient falls outside the age range.

Today's date is 2024-07-09

Put your answers to the user inside <answer></answer> XML tags

Here is an example:
<example>
{
    "Inclusion Criteria":{
        "Age between 12-55": {
            "Answer":"good candidate",
            "Explanation":"The person's birthdate was 1996-12-10 which makes the patient 28 years old"
        },
        "History of Disease A":{
            "Answer":"likely good candidate",
            "Explanation":"There is evidence that the person has had Disease A in the encounter on 2022-01-31"
        }
    },
    "Exclusion Criteria":{
        "Age greater than 55": {
            "Answer":"good candidate",
            "Explanation":"The person's birthdate was 1996-12-10 which makes the patient 28 years old which is not an age greater than 55"
        },
        "History of Disease B": {
            "Answer":"likely bad candidate",
            "Explanation":"I did not find evidence of the patient for Disease B in the previous encounters but they had a related disease of Disease C as referenced by the doct's visit on 2021-10-13"
        },
    }
}
</example>

content.text:
<answer>
{
    "Inclusion Criteria": {
        "18-65 years of age": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "The patient's birthdate is 1992-09-26, which makes them 31 years old as of today (2024-07-09), falling within the 18-65 age range."
        },
        "Chief complaint of headache": {
            "Answer": "bad candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of a chief complaint of headache. The encounters and conditions are related to respiratory symptoms and COVID-19."
        },
        "International Classification of Headache Disorder classification of migraine or probable migraine with or without aura": {
            "Answer": "bad candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of a diagnosis or classification of migraine or probable migraine."
        },
        "Has decision making capacity": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record to suggest a lack of decision making capacity."
        },
        "Consent": {
            "Answer": "likely good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no information provided about whether the patient has given consent or not. This would need to be obtained before enrolling the patient in the study."
        },
        "Provider determination of non-emergent cause": {
            "Answer": "likely bad candidate",
            "Explanation": "The patient was diagnosed with COVID-19, which is typically considered an emergent condition requiring medical attention and treatment."
        }
    },
    "Exclusion Criteria": {
        "Over the age of 50 with first time headache": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "The patient is 31 years old, which is not over the age of 50."
        },
        "Known adverse reaction or tolerance to study medication": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no information provided about any known adverse reactions or tolerances to study medications."
        },
        "Headache due to trauma": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of a headache due to trauma."
        },
        "New onset, focal, abnormal, neurologic findings": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of new onset, focal, or abnormal neurologic findings."
        },
        "New onset seizures": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of new onset seizures."
        },
        "History of metastatic cancer or neoplasm": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of a history of metastatic cancer or neoplasm."
        },
        "Active psychotic symptoms": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of active psychotic symptoms."
        },
        "Altered mental status": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of altered mental status."
        },
        "Provider intends to preform lumbar puncture": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record that a provider intends to perform a lumbar puncture."
        },
        "Pregnancy": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "The patient's gender is listed as male, so pregnancy is not applicable."
        },
        "Breast feeding": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "The patient's gender is listed as male, so breastfeeding is not applicable."
        },
        "Previous enrollment in study": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of previous enrollment in this study."
        },
        "Fever > 100.3 F": {
            "Answer": "likely bad candidate",
            "Explanation": "The patient had a recorded body temperature of 41 Celsius (105.8 Fahrenheit) on 2020-03-15, which exceeds the exclusion criteria of fever > 100.3 F."
        },
        "Physiologic instability (blood pressure < 90/50 or >170/100, heart rate <50 or >120, chronic respiratory, renal or hepatic failure)": {
            "Answer": "likely bad candidate",
            "Explanation": "The patient had a recorded blood pressure of 114/73 mmHg and heart rate of 110 bpm on 2020-03-15, which suggests physiologic instability with an elevated heart rate."
        },
        "Suspected cardiac pain": {
            "Answer": "good candidate",
            "Explanation": "There is no evidence in the patient record of suspected cardiac pain."
        }
    }
}
</answer>

(likely bad candidate) It is unlikely that this patient is a good candidate for the scientific study but more information might be needed.
(bad candidate) No this patient is not a good candidate for the scientific study.

and an explanation with references to the patient information for why you chose each response

in a JSON reponse.

If there is no evidence in the patient record for a exclusion condition, choose good candidate.

If the Inclusion criteria you are evaluating is an age range, choose good candidate if the patient falls within the age range, choose bad candidate if the patient falls outside the age range.

<example>

    },
    "Exclusion Criteria":{

        "History of Disease B": {

            "Explanation":"I did not find evidence of the patient for Disease B in the previous encounters but they had a related disease of Disease C as referenced by the doct's visit on 2021-10-13"
        },
    }
}
</example>

modelInput.system: You are acting as a researcher evaluating if a patient profile is suitable for a clinical trial.

messages.content:
We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.

(likely bad candidate) It is unlikely that this patient is a good candidate for the scientific study but more information might be needed.
(bad candidate) No this patient is not a good candidate for the scientific study.

in a JSON reponse.

messages.content:
We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.

Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.

Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

(bad candidate) No this patient is not a good candidate for the scientific study.

in a JSON reponse.

        },
    }

</example>

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

modelInput.system: You are acting as a researcher evaluating if a patient profile is suitable for a clinical trial.

messages.content:
We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.

modelInput.system: You are acting as a researcher evaluating if a patient profile is suitable for a clinical trial.

messages.content:
We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.

We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

        }

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

messages.content:
We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

messages.content:
We are looking to evaluate if a patient is a good candidate based on the criteria for a scientific study.

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile.

Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

If the Inclusion criteria you are evaluating is an age range, choose good candidate if the patient falls within the age range, choose bad candidate if the patient falls outside the age range.

Today's date is 2024-07-09

Put your answers to the user inside <answer></answer> XML tags

Here is an example:
<example>
{
    "Inclusion Criteria":{
        "Age between 12-55": {
            "Answer":"good candidate",
            "Explanation":"The person's birthdate was 1996-12-10 which makes the patient 28 years old"
        },
        "History of Disease A":{
            "Answer":"likely good candidate",
            "Explanation":"There is evidence that the person has had Disease A in the encounter on 2022-01-31"
        }
    },
    "Exclusion Criteria":{
        "Age greater than 55": {
            "Answer":"good candidate",
            "Explanation":"The person's birthdate was 1996-12-10 which makes the patient 28 years old which is not an age greater than 55"
        },
        "History of Disease B": {
            "Answer":"likely bad candidate",
            "Explanation":"I did not find evidence of the patient for Disease B in the previous encounters but they had a related disease of Disease C as referenced by the doct's visit on 2021-10-13"
        },
    }
}
</example>

messages.content:

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile.

Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

(likely bad candidate) It is unlikely that this patient is a good candidate for the scientific study but more information might be needed.
(bad candidate) No this patient is not a good candidate for the scientific study.

and an explanation with references to the patient information for why you chose each response

in a JSON reponse.

If there is no evidence in the patient record for a exclusion condition, choose good candidate.

If the Inclusion criteria you are evaluating is an age range, choose good candidate if the patient falls within the age range, choose bad candidate if the patient falls outside the age range.

    "Exclusion Criteria":{

        "History of Disease B": {
            "Answer":"likely bad candidate",
            "Explanation":"I did not find evidence of the patient for Disease B in the previous encounters but they had a related disease of Disease C as referenced by the doct's visit on 2021-10-13"
        },
    }
}
</example>

Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.

(likely bad candidate) It is unlikely that this patient is a good candidate for the scientific study but more information might be needed.
(bad candidate) No this patient is not a good candidate for the scientific study.

and an explanation with references to the patient information for why you chose each response

in a JSON reponse.

If there is no evidence in the patient record for a exclusion condition, choose good candidate.

If the Inclusion criteria you are evaluating is an age range, choose good candidate if the patient falls within the age range, choose bad candidate if the patient falls outside the age range.

<example>

        }
    },
    "Exclusion Criteria":{

        "History of Disease B": {
            "Answer":"likely bad candidate",
            "Explanation":"I did not find evidence of the patient for Disease B in the previous encounters but they had a related disease of Disease C as referenced by the doct's visit on 2021-10-13"
        },
    }
}
</example>

Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.
Inside <observation></observation> XML tags is a list of the patient's observations from healthcare providers.
Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

(bad candidate) No this patient is not a good candidate for the scientific study.

}

Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.

Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study

Inside <patient></patient> XML tags is the patient profile. 
Inside <encounter></encounter> XML tags is a list of the patient's encounters with healthcare providers.

Inside <condition></condition> XML tags is a list of the patient's conditions diagnosed by healthcare providers.
Inside <procedure></procedure> XML tags is a list of the patient's procedures from healthcare providers.
Inside <medicationRequest></medicationRequest> XML tags is a list of the patient's prescription medication requests.
Inside <study></study> XML tags is the criteria of a scientific study
